The Frieze Sculpture at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York has added two new works by Russian artists. Nikolay Gusev and Oleg Kalinic are joining the gallery from the Museum of Modern Art in Moscow, where they have worked since 2006. The pair, who have exhibited their work at the Met and at the State Museum of Fine Arts in Vladivostok, were selected from a shortlist of six artists that included Sergei Tarkovsky, Peter Hujar, Christo, Hiroshi Ogawa, and Yuri Slezkine.Gusev and Kalinic will each receive an additional $2,500 for their work, which will be installed in the exhibition “Vladimir and Oleg” at the Met.
